newsitem.title: USA: Hi-Lo Auto sets shareholder rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Hi-Lo Auto sets shareholder rights plan.

text.p: Hi-Lo Automotive Inc said on Friday that its board of directors has authorized the adoption of a stockholder rights plan.
This plan is designed to assure that all Hi/LO stockholders receive fair and equal treatment in the event of a proposed takeover of Hi/Lo, the company said.
The rights will be issued on September 3, 1996, to stockholders of record on that date and will expire on September 2, 2006, the company said.

One right will be issued for each outstanding share of stock and the rights will go into effect if a person or group acquires 15 percent or more of the company's voting stock or announces a tender offer for that amount, Hi-Lo said.
The stockholder rights plan is not being adopted at this time in response to any pending takeover threat to Hi/LO, the company said.
